page.title: 19Landscape of Yewdale 2
page.content: The Northern Parishes Water Supply Scheme, opened in 1973, is centred on {Levers Water}and{Coppermines Valley. Water is treated and stored at the Paddy End works, at the rate of 13630 cubic metres per day, to supply villages from Wray in the north-east to Broughton Beck in the south-west. The high mineral content of the water is reduced by adding soda ash; filtration and chlorination then permit the water to be distributed. In no way has the scheme adversely affected the landscape, and an important water-gathering function has been given to the fells in addition to their traditional uses. During the drought of 1984 this area, unlike most of the region, had no restrictions imposed on water usage - mainly due to the large catchment area serving a relatively small population.
